[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "He looked at the hollow of the gulch and cursed it manfully and bitterly."
[GRAMMAR]: "He could not call her mercenary. He knew better." - abrupt transition between sentences.
"He drew out her photograph, and obtained much sweet consolation by thinking how happy they two would be..." - long, complex sentence with awkward phrasing.
"He was the more enraged and hurt at the rest because of that." - awkward phrasing.
"Sick of this ingenious torture, he lit his pipe and drew savagely upon it." - awkward phrasing.
"With a mocking gurgle, about a dram of 'slumgullion' passed into his mouth." - awkward phrasing.
"He spat out the biting, nauseating stuff, hurled the pipe upon the rocks and danced on it." - awkward coordination of actions.
"He conveyed the idea in one brief word." - awkward phrasing.
